location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 39/6 (10/8) Oil concessions in W Arabia & Asir'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers in the file are arranged chronologically. There are file notes at the end, on folio 11. The notes are arranged chronologically and refer to documents within the file.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 13; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 2-10; these numbers are written in ink and in pencil, but are not circled, and are located in the same position as the main sequence.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence between the British Agent at Sharjah, the British Legation at Jedda, the Foreign Office and the Political Resident at Bahrain. The correspondence discusses the possibility of an oil concession in Asir and Western Arabia by the Eastern and General Syndicate and California-Arabian Standard Oil (CASOC).

name.namePart: Eastern and General Syndicate Limited, oil company
